title: error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
<short summary of the bug>

I tried this code:

<rustc main.rs>

I expected to see this happen: <Hello, world!>

Instead, this happened: 
```
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at 'src/librustc_codegen_ssa/back/write.rs:1488: worker thread panicked', src/librustc/util/bug.rs:37:26
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.40.0 (73528e339 2019-12-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

error: could not write output to main.4s37gsrti678ik8u.rcgu.o: Permission denied

error: aborting due to previous error
```

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
rustc 1.40.0 (73528e339 2019-12-16)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 73528e339aae0f17a15ffa49a8ac608f50c6cf14
commit-date: 2019-12-16
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.40.0
LLVM version: 9.0

Next I ran <```RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc main.rs```>

The result:
```
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at 'src/librustc_codegen_ssa/back/write.rs:1488: worker thread panicked', src/librustc/util/bug.rs:37:26
stack backtrace:
   0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:88
   1: backtrace::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66
   2: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print_fmt
             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:77
   3: <std::sys_common::backtrace::_print::DisplayBacktrace as core::fmt::Display>::fmt
             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:61
   4: core::fmt::write
             at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1028
   5: std::io::Write::write_fmt
             at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1412
   6: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print
             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:65
   7: std::sys_common::backtrace::print
             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:50
   8: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:188
   9: std::panicking::default_hook
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:205
  10: rustc_driver::report_ice
  11: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:468
  12: std::panicking::begin_panic
  13: rustc::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt::{{closure}}
  14: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}}
  15: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_context_opt
  16: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_opt
  17: rustc::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt
  18: rustc::util::bug::bug_fmt
  19: rustc_codegen_ssa::back::write::start_executing_work::{{closure}}
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace
```

Thank you
